bugs.title: README.rpm is bad name for readme file

bugzilla.short_desc: README.rpm is bad name for readme file

blocked.short_desc: README.rpm is bad name for readme file
`rpm -qp  README.rpm` hangs  when the 'README.rpm' is text file

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 1278076
Example file

The /usr/share/doc/roundcubemail/README.rpm text file is attached.

This is what I get:

    $ rpm -qp  /tmp/README.rpm 
    error: open of Additional failed: No such file or directory
    error: open of installation failed: No such file or directory
    error: open of and failed: No such file or directory
    error: open of update failed: No such file or directory
    error: open of information: failed: No such file or directory
    error: open of Upstream failed: No such file or directory
    error: open of documentation: failed: No such file or directory
    ^Cerror: open of http://trac.roundcube.net/wiki failed: Interrupted
    system call
    error: open of Notice failed: No such file or directory
    ^C^C^C^C^C^C^C^C^C^C^C^C^C^C^C^Z
    [2]+  Stopped                 rpm -qp /tmp/README.rpm
    $ killall -9 rpm
    [2]+  Killed                  rpm -qp /tmp/README.rpm

Seems like rpm is also trying to reach internet?


+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #1449790 +++
+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #1449517 +++

Well, works as intended ... ehm ... may be ...

RPM allows passing manifest files at the command line. These files are supposed to contain file names of packages or other manifest files.

So rpm tries to open all these "file names".

As far as I can see it does not try to access the internet but tries to open the URL as a file name (and fails).

There seems to be an issue with rpm treating the "-" from the file as stdin. This results in rpm waiting for the user to type in more package names. Removing all the standalone "-" signs makes rpm go through the file without stopping.

Upstream has a few more checks in place now rejecting the file right away. There also is some code to not open stdin on encountering "-".

> As far as I can see it does not try to access the internet but tries to open
> the URL as a file name (and fails).

$ strace -e execve -f rpm -qp /tmp/README.rpm
....
strace: Process 31757 attached
[pid 31757] execve("/usr/bin/curl", ["/usr/bin/curl", "--silent", "--show-error", "--fail", "--globoff", "--location", "-o", "/var/tmp/rpm-tmp.lQSoq1", "http://trac.roundcube.net/wiki"], [/* 90 vars */]) = 0
....
strace: Process 31760 attached
[pid 31760] execve("/usr/bin/curl", ["/usr/bin/curl", "--silent", "--show-error", "--fail", "--globoff", "--location", "-o", "/var/tmp/rpm-tmp.rhKYfQ", "http://trac.roundcube.net/wiki"], [/* 90 vars */]) = 0
....

> Upstream has a few more checks in place now rejecting the file right
> away. There also is some code to not open stdin on encountering "-".

Ok, good to know.  What is your suggestion for the 'less' (bug 1449790)
issue?  Can I detect (without file) that "README.rpm" is manifest file,
and open the file as text file (without using file)?  Thanks!

I think this is the wrong question. The manifest files are not supposed to end with .rpm. So the issue here is not detecting manifest files names *.rpm but detecting any improper files named *.rpm. There has been a lot of work improving file checks upstream (by Panu mostly).

Proper manifest files can and should end with .txt or something like that. So they already should be listed correctly.

So the right answer here is rpm becoming more robust when being passed garbage. This is something happening right now.

Wrt less: Using file instead of the ending alone would make things more robust. There is no real way around that other that reimplementing the check used by file: looking for the magic bytes at the beginning of an rpm package.

> Proper manifest files can and should end with .txt or something like that. So
> they already should be listed correctly.

Ah, OK.  Then it should be safe to do 'rpm -qp --nomanifest', do I get it right?
yes.

+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #1449517 +++

Description of problem:

less /usr/share/doc/roundcubemail-1.1.9/README.rpm

lesspipe.sh invokes rpm to parse README.rpm file and rpm hangs so badly you can't even terminate it from same terminal.

Please rename the file to something which doesn't have .rpm extension. I'd suggest README.rpm-install.

Fedora version has exactly same problem so I suggest fixing this same issue there too.

--- Additional comment from Remi Collet on 2017-05-10 11:43:20 CEST ---

I plan to fix this minor issue during next update

Already fixed in my repo, used as upstream for Fedora:
https://git.remirepo.net/cgit/rpms/roundcubemail.git/commit/?id=a0d08f6587f09706a221dcf327ab96b84164c2e7

--- Additional comment from Remi Collet on 2017-05-10 12:07:14 CEST ---

Adding less maintained to CC, as this probably other packages (.rpm was quite commonly used name for readme file, since .fedora was discouraged)

Could be nice, if this can be fixed globally on "less" side.

--- Additional comment from Tuomo Soini on 2017-05-10 12:12:47 CEST ---

Actually dnf only found some other pakcages with same issue on F25.

cyrus-imapd
iipsrv
mozldap
slrn-pull

--- Additional comment from Pavel Raiskup on 2017-05-10 14:51:35 CEST ---

FWIW: In PostgreSQL packaging, we use 'README.rpmdist'.
lesspipe.sh already uses file - maybe it should use file command to find out if files are actually desired file type?

Based on discussion with Kevin, I added the --nomanifest option into
lesspipe.sh:
http://pkgs.fedoraproject.org/cgit/rpms/less.git/commit/?id=f32e1da3d76fa34a53cd

> Based on discussion with Kevin

Sorry, I meant Florian -> in bug 1450277.  Thanks!

bugs.title: CVE-2018-9846 roundcubemail: MX injection in archive.php [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-9846 roundcubemail: MX injection in archive.php [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-9846 roundcubemail: MX injection in archive.php

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was found in Roundcube from versions 1.2.0 to 1.3.5, with the archive plugin enabled and configured, it's possible to exploit the unsanitized, user-controlled "_uid" parameter (in an archive.php _task=mail&_mbox=INBOX&_action=plugin.move2archive request) to perform an MX (IMAP) injection attack by placing an IMAP command after a %0d%0a sequence. NOTE: this is less easily exploitable in 1.3.4 and later because of a Same Origin Policy protection mechanism.


References:
https://github.com/roundcube/roundcubemail/issues/6229
https://github.com/roundcube/roundcubemail/issues/6238
https://medium.com/@ndrbasi/cve-2018-9846-roundcube-303097048b0a

Patch:
https://github.com/roundcube/roundcubemail/commit/e3dd5b66d236867572e68fcb80281e9268a0cfb0

Created roundcubemail tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1566744]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of epel-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora EPEL. While
only one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions
at the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each
other, you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1566743,1566744

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by remi.
This update has obsoleted [roundcubemail-1.1.11-1.el7](https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2018-26155198e1), and has inherited its bugs and notes.
This update has been pushed to testing.

remi edited this update.

New build(s):

- roundcubemail-1.1.12-2.el7

Removed build(s):

- roundcubemail-1.1.12-1.el7

Karma has been reset.
This update has been submitted for testing by remi.
This update has been pushed to testing.
This update has reached 14 days in testing and can be pushed to stable now if the maintainer wishes
This update has been submitted for batched by remi.
This update has been submitted for stable by remi.
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes:
**Version 1.1.12**

This is a follow-up to the recent security update for the stable version 1.1. It fixes a regression that sneaked in with the IMAP command injection protection which unintentionally disabled actions that operate on all selected messages (e.g. mark all as junk).

We recommend to update all productive installations of Roundcube 1.1.11. Please do backup your data before updating!

CHANGELOG

*    Fix regression where IMAP commands with '*' uidset argument wasn't working

----

**Version 1.1.11**

This is a security update to the stable version 1.1. It fixes a recently reported vulnerability allowing IMAP command injection via a GET parameters. More details about this are published under CVE-2018-9846.

The second fix is about a missed remote content blocking on HTML messages with specially crafted image and style tags.

We strongly recommend to update all productive installations of Roundcube 1.1.x. Please do backup your data before updating!

CHANGELOG

*    Don't ignore (global) userlogins/sendmail logs in per_user_logging mode
*    Fix security issue in remote content blocking on HTML image and style tags (#6178)
*    Fix check_request() bypass in places using get_uids() [CVE-2018-9846] (#6238)
*    Fix possible IMAP command injection vulnerability [CVE-2018-9846] (#6229)
title: roundcubemail-1.1.12-2.el7
